Description: Round and flattened disc made of greyish-brownish clay, used as strainer. Broken into three fragments that were glued at some point, now broken apart again. The upper side is slightly concave and somewhat uneven but relatively smooth. 16 holes are pierced through the object from the underside while the clay was still wet. The diameter of the holes is approximately 0.4 cm. The lateral side is tapering inwards towards the underside. Some white accretions on the surface.
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
